author: Staff Reporter
text:
The members of Aathi Thamizhar Katchi staged a demonstration in front of the Collectorate here on Monday seeking the intervention of the district administration to build monuments for freedom fighters who hailed from Arunthathiyar caste at Panchalankurichi.

C. Dillip, district secretary, who led the agitation, said that four freedom fighters – Potti Pagadai, Muthan Pagadai, Kandhan Pagadai and Thaman Pagadai – who played a major role in the freedom movement along with legendary freedom fighter Veerapandiya Kattabomman against the British.

Since Arunthathiyar community was the most oppressed of the Scheduled Castes in the State, their significant contributions to the freedom of the country were simply hidden, he charged.
title: “Build monuments for Arunthathiyar freedom fighters”
